reviews.text: What a delightful station. With traditional brick buildings along each platform. The tracks are covered by a beautiful wrought metal roof with plenty of light.

I was served today by Jeff who was very helpful, courteous and whom provided me with outstanding customer service. My purchase today was for the very best price and was tailored to my needs perfectly! I do explore the online apps but you cannot compete with the value for money, inventory and any other assistance required by visiting the local station. He is a merit to your company and I hope he will be recognized for being a generally brilliant human being .

Large rail station with foot bridge over the rails to change between platforms. Toilets and cafes are in place, though the better to buy snacks elsewhere as cafes and shops are predictably overpriced .

Where is your first class lounge? The money you guys make off the back of your customers with your over priced tickets is ridiculous. It's time you started cleaning up your stations. Stood on a grubby platform waiting for my one-off treat of a first class seat. Not a fair use of your profits.

It hasn't got the best of station layouts but it has aged better than most stations on the line. Both sides have step free access and are connected by a step free ramped subway or footbridge.

Facilities in the station include somewhere to eat, toilets as well as direct access to the travel interchange for buses and coaches alike. Trains are crowded during the summer and there could be more space in the ticket hall but it's an ok station otherwise.
